title: How to Make Bloody Cupcakes

steps.headline: Prepare to make the cupcakes.
steps.description: Preheat the oven to 350 °F (177 °C). Place cupcake liners in each case of a cupcake tray.

steps.headline: Cream the butter and sugar in a large mixing bowl.
steps.description: Do this with a hand mixer or electric mixer until the mixture is light and fluffy.

steps.headline: Crack in the eggs, pour the vanilla, and add the red food coloring.
steps.description: Mix again until the mixture is creamy and resembles a red color.

steps.headline: Combine the dry ingredients.
steps.description: In a separate bowl, whisk the the flour, cocoa powder, cinnamon, and salt. Pour it in the creamed mixture and blend on low speed until the dry ingredients are folded in. The batter will be dry and slightly crumbly. This is normal.

steps.headline: Pour in the buttermilk, baking soda, and vinegar.
steps.description: Blend on low speed. The cupcake batter should start to form and resemble a vibrant red color. Blend until there are no more flour streaks.

steps.headline: Pour the cupcake batter into each case of the cupcake tray.
Bake the cupcakes for about 20 minutes, until the cupcakes rise and the edges are golden brown.
Have the cupcakes cool on a wire rack for about ten minutes, until cool enough to handle.
Make the frosting.
steps.description: Cream the butter and cream cheese on high speed using a hand mixer or electric mixer. Do so until fluffy. Slowly stir in the powdered sugar and blend on low speed. Pour in the vanilla and cinnamon and mix until well-combined. Place the frosting into a frosting pipe.

steps.headline: Frost all the cupcakes using the frosting pipe.
Make the candy glass mixture.
steps.description: Heat the sugar and water in a large pot, until it starts to boil and the sugar dissolves. Add 2/3 cup of corn syrup and cream of tartar. Stir slowly with a wooden spoon and have it continue to cook for about 15-20 minutes, until the mixture slightly thickens. The mixture should be a clear color, not brown. If the mixture starts to brown, that means it's getting too hot.

steps.headline: Pour the candy glass mixture on to a baking tray covered with parchment paper has been sprayed with non-stick greasing spray.
steps.description: Have it harden for about 10 minutes.

steps.headline: Crack the candy glass with a large, metal spoon by lightly banging on it.
steps.description: Remove the cracked pieces from the tray and carefully place them in a small bowl.

steps.headline: Make the "blood".
steps.description: Mix ten drops of red food coloring gel and two drops of blue food coloring to give the "blood" a more realistic look. Stir in the leftover corn syrup and mix until well-combined.

steps.headline: Decorate the cupcakes.
steps.description: Using a small spoon, drizzle the "blood" all over each cupcake. Poke two of cracked sugar candy pieces into each cupcake. Add more "blood" if desired.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Place a cupcake on a serving plate. Enjoy!

text: Making the Cupcakes Prepare to make the cupcakes. Preheat the oven to 350 °F (177 °C). Place cupcake liners in each case of a cupcake tray. Cream the butter and sugar in a large mixing bowl. Do this with a hand mixer or electric mixer until the mixture is light and fluffy. Crack in the eggs, pour the vanilla, and add the red food coloring. Mix again until the mixture is creamy and resembles a red color. Combine the dry ingredients. In a separate bowl, whisk the the flour, cocoa powder, cinnamon, and salt. Pour it in the creamed mixture and blend on low speed until the dry ingredients are folded in. The batter will be dry and slightly crumbly. This is normal. Pour in the buttermilk, baking soda, and vinegar. Blend on low speed. The cupcake batter should start to form and resemble a vibrant red color. Blend until there are no more flour streaks. Pour the cupcake batter into each case of the cupcake tray.  Bake the cupcakes for about 20 minutes, until the cupcakes rise and the edges are golden brown.  Have the cupcakes cool on a wire rack for about ten minutes, until cool enough to handle.  Frosting and Decorating Make the frosting. Cream the butter and cream cheese on high speed using a hand mixer or electric mixer. Do so until fluffy. Slowly stir in the powdered sugar and blend on low speed. Pour in the vanilla and cinnamon and mix until well-combined. Place the frosting into a frosting pipe. Frost all the cupcakes using the frosting pipe.  Make the candy glass mixture. Heat the sugar and water in a large pot, until it starts to boil and the sugar dissolves. Add 2/3 cup of corn syrup and cream of tartar. Stir slowly with a wooden spoon and have it continue to cook for about 15-20 minutes, until the mixture slightly thickens. The mixture should be a clear color, not brown. If the mixture starts to brown, that means it's getting too hot. Pour the candy glass mixture on to a baking tray covered with parchment paper has been sprayed with non-stick greasing spray. Have it harden for about 10 minutes. Crack the candy glass with a large, metal spoon by lightly banging on it. Remove the cracked pieces from the tray and carefully place them in a small bowl. Make the "blood". Mix ten drops of red food coloring gel and two drops of blue food coloring to give the "blood" a more realistic look. Stir in the leftover corn syrup and mix until well-combined. Decorate the cupcakes. Using a small spoon, drizzle the "blood" all over each cupcake. Poke two of cracked sugar candy pieces into each cupcake. Add more "blood" if desired. Serve. Place a cupcake on a serving plate. Enjoy!
